title: Microsoft Flight Simulator: The entire world in a game
description: The latest Flight Simulator title promises a near-perfect replica of the entire world.

title: RSPCA calls for more regulation in pet industry
description: Home footage captures a dog walker hitting a pet, as campaigners call for more regulation.

title: 19th amendment: A 100-year milestone for women... and what comes next
description: A hundred years after US women won the right to vote, female candidates reflect on what’s left to do.

title: Turkey's hidden domestic abuse: A survivor's story
description: Last year, more than 470 women in Turkey were killed by men they knew, according to campaigners.

title: Coronavirus: Families of victims call for full independent inquiry
description: Bereaved relatives tell the BBC why they want an immediate inquiry into the coronavirus pandemic.

title: With UAE deal, Israel opens tentative new chapter with Gulf Arabs
description: The UAE's decision to normalise relations with Israel is a gamble for the Gulf state, writes Frank Gardner.

title: Coronavirus: Students' stories of working on NHS front line
description: Three fast-tracked medical and nursing students tell their stories fighting Covid-19 on the wards.

title: Tracking down three billion litres of lost water
description: Pinpointing a leaky pipe is difficult, so water firms are deploying thousands of sophisticated sensors.

title: A-levels: Student foresaw exam crisis in winning story
description: The Orwell Youth Prize winner says she has "fallen into her own story" about an exam algorithm.

title: Egypt TikTok and Instagram stars pay heavy price for 'indecency'
description: They have millions of followers, but Egypt's social media stars are paying a heavy price.

title: Wellingborough floods 'flung the door open as I was tattooing'
description: Businesses are picking up the pieces as a town is hit by most of its monthly rainfall in an hour.

title: Belarus protests: 'There's no way back. The people will not forgive this'
description: Belarusian media figures tell the BBC how their lives have been turned upside down during the protests.
